title: Australian Stream and Catchment Environmental Data
description:
A suite of environmental layers calculated based on the Australian Hydrological Geospatial Fabric ('Geofabric') network that represents stream segments and their catchments

Geographic extent: Australia
Year range: N/A
Resolution: 9 arcsec (~250 m)
Data layers: 176 layers across 14 datasets, including vegetation, river disturbance, landuse and population
rights: CC-BY Share Alike Attribution 3.0 and Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International Licence
attribution: Stein JL, Hutchinson MF, Stein JA (2014) A new stream and nested catchment framework for Australia. Hydrology and Earth System Sciences, 18(5), 1917-1933.
external_description:
Includes the following datasets that are calculated for each stream segment, which refers to all grid cells comprising the stream segment and associated valley bottoms: Substrate, Vegetation, Land Use, Population, Terrain, Network, Connectivity. And the following datasets that are calculated for each catchment, which refers to all grid cells upstream of the center of the stream segment pour-point cell: Substrate, Vegetation, Land Use, Population, Terrain, Net Primary Productivity and River Disturbance.
Publication: See http://www.hydrol-earth-syst-sci.net/18/1917/2014/hess-18-1917-2014.pdf
Data source: https://data.gov.au/dataset/national-environmental-stream-attributes-v1-1-5
